record.description: [Four hundred art works donated by Joseph R. Shapiro are available on loan to University of Chicago students through the program, "Art to Live With." At a fee of one dollar per quarter (with other costs underwritten by the university), students can rent works by artists such as: Miró, Goya, Rouault, Matisse, Kandinsky, and Klee.]
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: 3 35mm negs on file. See Feb. 1968 U of C Magazine, pp.10-13.
